roleset.name: trigger, breeding/reproduction
roleset.note: PROPAGATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'propagate' based on ECTB. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'trigger'. (from propagate.01-v predicate notes)
PROPAGATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, propagate-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls entity_specific_modes_being-47.2, other_cos-45.4. (from propagation.01-n)

roles.note: Arg2-instrument from propogate-v.01 omitted because it's not expected. Arg3 left as arg3 for symmetry with the verb frame (from propagation.01-n)

example.text: Would it not be better placed [*0*]-1 [*]to propagate the Christian ideal of universal love *T*-1
example.arg: the Christian ideal of universal love

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: The cellular concentration of the yeast Ure2p prion protein affects its propagation as a prion.

example.name: arg1
example.text: These chemical reactions are usually triggered by behaviors which are positive in terms of species propagation .

example.name: arg0 = cause
example.text: EEG seizure patterns and their propagation of the experimental convulsion
